properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 7 at 4:43PM CST until February 9 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Jackson MS
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a Flood Warning
for the following rivers in Mississippi...

Pearl River Above Philadelphia affecting Neshoba County

The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The Pearl River Above Philadelphia
* from this evening to Sunday evening.
* At 3:45 PM Friday the stage was 12.7 feet and rising.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Flood stage is 13 feet.
* Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this evening and
will continue to rise to a crest near 13.5 feet Saturday afternoon.
* Flood history...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14 feet
on Mar 5 2019.
* Impact...At 13 feet...Water begins to affect Burnside Lake Water
Park.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive or walk through areas where water covers roadway! The
water may be deeper than it appears. Remember...Turn around, don't
drown!

Please note that forecast crests are based upon rainfall that has
occurred along with forecast rainfall for the next 24 hours.

Additional information is available at:
https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN

The next regularly scheduled update is expected between 8 and 10 AM.
